channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Iran’s efforts to reengage with West face new challenges
item.dc:creator: Susannah George, Karen DeYoung, Suzan Haidamous
item.description: U.S. sanctions over Iran’s missile deal with Russia are unlikely to derail President Masoud Pezeshkian’s efforts to bring his country out of isolation, diplomats say.

item.title: U.K. Labour strategists advise Harris on winning from the center left
item.dc:creator: Karla Adam
item.description: After Keir Starmer led the Labour Party to a big win in July’s election, U.K. strategists say they have relevant insights to share with Kamala Harris’s campaign.

item.title: How Mexico is helping Biden and Harris at the U.S. border
item.dc:creator: Mary Beth Sheridan
item.description: A major reason for the drop in apprehensions at the border this year: Mexico is stopping migrants well before they reach the border.

item.title: Four Islamic State leaders killed in August raid in Iraq, U.S. says
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong
item.description: Military officials said those killed in a dramatic mission by U.S. and Iraqi forces last month included the extremist group’s head of operations in Iraq.

item.title: Russia expels U.K. diplomats; Putin warns against deep strikes with Western weapons
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon
item.description: The Russian president issued his sternest warning to date about the use of Western weapons in Ukraine ahead of a meeting of British and U.S. leaders.

item.title: Pope Francis says Harris and Trump are ‘against life’
item.dc:creator: Maegan Vazquez, Mikhail Klimentov
item.description: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris’s immigration and abortion stances drew a stern response from Pope Francis, who advised Catholics in the U.S. to choose the “lesser evil.”

item.title: U.S. says Russian state media outlet runs intelligence operations
item.dc:creator: Catherine Belton
item.description: The State Department accuses RT, the Russian media outlet, of running intelligence operations and procuring weapons for the war in Ukraine.

item.title: Zelensky said his victory plan will lead to ‘reliable peace’ in Ukraine
item.dc:creator: David Stern
item.description: Without revealing more details, Zelensky once again talked about the plan he will bring to President Joe Biden on how to end the war with Russia.

item.title: North Korea reveals uranium site as Kim Jong Un demands more nuclear weapons
item.dc:creator: Andrew Jeong, Victoria Bisset
item.description: The North Korean leader called for stronger efforts to “exponentially increase” the number of nuclear weapons in the country.

item.title: Eiffel’s descendants say ‘non’ to keeping Olympic rings on Eiffel Tower
item.dc:creator: Juliette Fekkar, Ellen Francis
item.description: The Paris mayor wants the Olympic logo to stay on the monument. Gustave Eiffel’s descendants say the tower shouldn’t be a permanent billboard.

item.title: Russian counteroffensive in Ukrainian-controlled Kursk begins, says Zelensky
item.dc:creator: Anastacia Galouchka, Lizzie Johnson
item.description: Zelensky said that the Russian counteroffensive had long been expected and was planned for.

item.title: Kyiv’s bombed children’s hospital rebuilds, and one boy heads home
item.dc:creator: Lizzie Johnson, Anastacia Galouchka
item.description: Hundreds with severe medical needs were displaced by July’s missile strike on Okhmatdyt Children’s Hospital in Kyiv, but the hospital was rebuilt and many returned.

item.title: A new crisis may plunge Libya back into chaos
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: The recent dramas gripping the country have been shadowy, shaped by backroom deals, black market transfers and illicit smuggling.

item.title: Is the new statue of the late Queen Elizabeth II really that ... bad?
item.dc:creator: María Luisa Paúl
item.description: The newly unveiled sculpture at Antrim Castle Gardens in Northern Ireland was compared online to Robin Williams’s character in the 1993 movie “Mrs. Doubtfire.”

item.title: Afghan women defy Taliban and continue medical school in Scotland
item.dc:creator: Daniel Wu
item.description: The Scottish government granted free tuition to female students from Afghanistan to continue studying medicine after the Taliban upended their education.

item.title: U.N. agency says six of its staff among those killed in Israeli strikes
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel, Hazem Balousha, Frances Vinall, Victoria Bisset, Adam Taylor
item.description: The workers were killed when two airstrikes hit a Gaza refugee camp, said UNRWA, the U.N. agency for Palestinian refugees. Israel said it targeted Hamas militants.

item.title: Gaza’s traumatized children are facing another lost year of school
item.dc:creator: Kareem Fahim, Hajar Harb
item.description: About 650,000 students are missing their second school year, an absence educators say will compound the trauma of war and could cause lasting developmental problems.
